50241.title: Certification Data
50241.description: The information provided on the "Certification Data" overview page MUST match the product.

50242.50277.title: Z-Wave Plus v2 Software Application Product
50242.50277.note: Software is certified; requires Certified Z-Wave Hardware Platform product to run on.

50242.50277.50278.title: Certified Z-Wave Stack
50242.50277.50278.description: The product is based on a standard Z-Wave stack.

50242.50277.50278.50279.description: The software application runs on a PC or similar

50242.50277.50278.50279.50280.description: The application uses the standard Z-Wave Serial API
50242.50277.50278.50279.50280.note: either directly or hidden through another library layer

50289.title: Frequency Plans (RF Regions) and Countries or Regions
50289.description: Use the below items to select all frequency plans (RF regions) and countries or regions that apply for this product in accordance with the Z-Wave Alliance Z-Wave Frequency and Region List.

50289.50290.50291.50296.note:
Used in the following countries: Armenia, Bahrain, CEPT (Europe), Cyprus, Moldova, Egypt, French Guiana, Georgia, Iraq, Jordan, Kazakstan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya,
Maldives, Mauritius, Nigeria, Oman, Philippines, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Turkmenistan, United Arab Emirates (UAE), Uzbekistan, Yemen

50323.title: Select the Device and Role Type of your product
50323.description:
Please select the primary Device and Role Type of your product here. Information regarding self-testing can be found in the Wiki which is accessed by clicking on the ? icons in the individual line items.

If the product is a Multiple NIF device with more than one Role Type, please select all implemented Role Types in this section.

50323.50517.title: Generic Controller DT
50323.50517.description: The Generic Controller Device Type is intended for all more constrained or simple controllers allowing users to make basic use of the Z-Wave network and controlling a pre-defined set of actuator nodes as well as unknown actuator nodes.
50323.50517.note: Note: The Gateway DT is the correct replacement for all CSC based Controllers from the Z-Wave Plus v1 program.

50323.50517.50518.50520.description: The DUT does NOT support Learn Mode.
50323.50517.50518.50520.note: Caution! General adaptions apply on how to setup a Z-Wave network for testing purposes.

50852.title: Generic Controller DT
50852.description: The Generic Controller Device Type is intended for all more constrained or simple controllers allowing users to make basic use of the Z-Wave network and controlling a pre-defined set of actuator nodes as well as unknown actuator nodes.

50852.50853.description:
The Generic Controller Device Type MUST use the following Device Classes:
  • GENERIC_TYPE_GENERIC_CONTROLLER (0x01)
  • SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOT_USED (0x00)

50852.50854.description: The Generic Controller implements the following Security Class as the highest Class:

50852.50854.50855.50856.description: The Generic Controller MAY also implement the S2 Authenticated Security Class

50852.50854.50855.50857.description: The Generic Controller MAY also implement the S2 Unauthenticated Security Class

50852.50860.description: The Generic Controller MUST support the following Command Classes:

50852.50862.description: The Generic Controller MUST provide full control of the following Command Classes:
50852.50862.note:
DT:32.11.0003.3
Note: Selected mandatory controlled Command Classes will automatically trigger "Control" in the Command Class sections and pre-select "Full Control" in the CCR section for the respective Command Class.
The below list contains minimum Command Class versions. If higher versions are controlled, this can be selected in the Command Class sections.

50852.50862.50865.description: The mandatory actuator Command Classes of at least one actuator Device Type:
50852.50862.50865.note: Note: The actuator Command Classes of below selected Device Types will automatically be selected as <u>fully controlled</u> in the CCR section.

50852.50862.50865.50868.note:
Color Switch CC v3
Binary Switch CC v2
Multilevel Switch CC v4

50852.50862.50865.50869.note:
Window Covering CC v1
Multilevel Switch CC v4

50852.50862.50865.50870.note:
Thermostat Mode CC v3
Thermostat Setpoint CC v1

50852.50877.description: A Generic Controller Device Type MAY provide full control or partial control of any other Command Class not listed above.

50852.50878.description: Basic Command Class MUST NOT be supported

50889.title: Central Static Controller (CSC) Role Type
50889.description:
The Central Static Controller Role Type is intended for always powered devices which are capable of operating as a central controller. The CSC will be the central device for most network communications and other devices will rely on it for unsolicited information via the lifeline association to the CSC (which is also the SIS). This will enable the user to receive key information without having to perform major network configuration tasks.
The CSC is typically a router, central gateway or some sort of central communication panel.

50889.50890.description: The CSC MUST support the Static Update Controller (SUC) and SUC node ID Server (SIS) functions.

50889.50891.description: The CSC MUST be mains powered and MAY have a battery back-up.

50889.50892.description: The CSC MUST set the listening flag to 1 in its NIF.

50889.50893.description: The CSC MUST support and control the S0 and S2 Command Classes.

50889.50894.50896.description: A controller that supports SIS functionality MUST assume the SIS role when creating a new network.

50889.50897.header: If first node in the network
50889.50897.description: If the CSC is the first node in the network, it MUST set itself the SIS role and MUST support the following network functions:

50889.50897.50898.50899.description: The SIS MUST show the new added nodes in the list of included nodes after an inclusion has been carried out by an Inclusion Controller.

50889.50897.50901.50902.description: Before removing a non-responsive NodeID from a network, a controller shall issue NOP commands to the non-responsive NodeID. If the node is not responding, the controller shall proceed with removing the NodeID and updating the network.

50889.50897.50901.50903.description: A responding node shall not be removed from the network by a controller without using Classic Exclusion or Network Wide Exclusion.

50889.50897.50904.description:
Additionally, it MAY support the following network function:
  • Replace failing node
  • Learn Mode

50889.50897.50904.50905.50909.description: The DUT does NOT support the Replace Failed Node function.

50889.50897.50904.50910.50913.description: The DUT does NOT support the Learn Mode function.
50889.50897.50904.50910.50913.note: Caution! General adaptions apply on how to setup a Z-Wave network for testing purposes.

50889.50914.50915.description: If the DUT is the SIS: it MUST set itself as the Association group ID 1 (Lifeline) destination.

50889.50917.description: When the SIS is present, an including node MUST always assign SIS return route when including an end node.
50889.50917.note:
RT:01.11.0016.1

Details and requirements about establishing the Lifeline are provided in the Command Class Control Specification.

50889.50918.header: CSC Setup - CSC including an SSC, PC, RPC or NAEN
50889.50918.description: If the CSC is the SIS and the included node is of Role Type RPC:

50889.50918.50919.description: The CSC MUST configure the Wake Up Interval Set Command destination NodeID to its NodeID.

50889.50918.50920.description: The CSC MUST send a Wake Up No More Information Command when the CSC has no more command to transmit.

50889.50921.header: CSC Setup - CSC including a PEN, LSEN or RSEN
50889.50921.description:
If the CSC is the SIS and the included node is of Role Type PEN or RSEN, the CSC MUST:
  • configure the Wake Up Interval Set Command destination NodeID to its NodeID.
  • send a Wake Up No More Information Command when the CSC has no more command to transmit.

50889.50922.description: If the CSC is the SIS and the included node is of Role Type PEN:

50889.50922.50923.description: If the node advertises Wake-Up Capabilities (Wake-Up Command Class, version 2 or newer), the Wake Up Interval Set Command Seconds field MUST be within the allowed range.

50889.50944.description: The CSC MUST instruct a reporting node (RPC, RSEN, PEN) to return to sleep after application data has been delivered to the node. This is done by sending a Wake Up No More Information Command.

50889.50945.description: A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST either support to be included in a network using SmartStart inclusion or provide SmartStart inclusion of other nodes. A controller providing SmartStart inclusion of other nodes MAY also support being included in a network using SmartStart inclusion.

50889.50945.50947.description: DUT can perform SmartStart inclusion of other nodes

51084.header: How to detect Z-Wave Plus v2 compliant nodes
51084.description: A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST advertise version 0x02 in the Z-Wave Plus Version field of the Z-Wave Plus Info Report. Multi Channel End Points MUST advertise the same version number in their Z-Wave Plus Info Report.

51085.description: A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST set the Optional Functionality bit to 1 in its NIF.

51086.description: The Role Type of a node can be requested via the Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class, which MUST be listed as the first supported Command Class in the Node Information Frame (NIF) by all Z-Wave Plus nodes.

51087.description:
All Root Devices or nodes MUST support:
  • Association, version 2
  • Association Group Information
  • Device Reset Locally
  • Firmware Update Meta Data, version 5
  • Indicator, version 3
  • Manufacturer Specific
  • Multi Channel Association, version 3
  • Powerlevel
  • Security 2
  • Supervision
  • Transport Service, version 2
  • Version, version 2
  • Z-Wave Plus Info, version 2

51088.description:
Device Types MAY support optional Command Classes on top of the minimum mandatory set of supported Command Classes. However, the following Command Classes MUST NOT be supported optionally in a Device Type:
  • Motorized barrier
  • Color Switch
  • Window Covering
  • Multilevel Switch
  • Thermostat Mode
  • Thermostat Setpoint
  • Thermostat Setback
  • Sound Switch
  • Simple AV Control
  • Binary Switch

51088.51089.description:
It means that if supported, these command classes MUST fit the exact actuator Command Class list of a Device Type. If several actuator Command Classes not belonging to the Device Type need to be supported, they MUST be partitioned in End Points which match the actuator Command Class list of a Device Type.

Multi Channel Root Devices MAY still aggregate some of the above mentioned Command Classes from their end points for backwards compatibility. The optional Command Class rule applies:
  • For the node (Root Device) if the node does not support Multi Channel Command Class
  • For each and every end point if the node supports the Multi Channel Command Class

51090.description:
A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST support an Identify indicator (Indicator ID 0x50) which can be used for an Identify function.

The node is RECOMMENDED to use a visible LED for an identify function if it has an LED. If the node is itself a light source, e.g. a light bulb, this MAY be used in place of a dedicated LED.

51091.description: The Root Device of a node MUST support the Indicator Command Class, version 3 and support the Indicator ID 0x50 (Identify) and Properties ID 0x03, 0x04 and 0x05.

51092.description: Nodes (and their End Points) MAY change capabilities based on a user action, such as changing configuration parameters or the physical addition/removal of a module.

51092.51101.description: The DUT can NOT change capabilities.

51103.description: The device MUST be able to issue a Device Reset Locally Command via its Lifeline to notify the Lifeline destination that the device has been reset to its factory default state.

51104.description: If a device is reset, it MUST perform the reset operation regardless of whether or not the delivery of the Device Reset Locally Notification is successful or not.

51105.description: It is RECOMMENDED that devices implement a mechanism that allows the user to determine when the reset operation is completed.

51105.51106.description: The DUT follows the above recommendation.

51108.51109.description: It MUST forget its current HomeID and consider itself excluded from the network.

51108.51110.description: The configuration of other Command Classes (Management, Transport or Network) MUST be reset to default (i.e. S2 keys are forgotten, Associations and Wake-Up configurations are cleared, etc.)

51111.description: During a node capability discovery or interview, as well as traffic generated due to user activation, a controlling nodes MUST timeout waiting for responses (reports) as part of the capability discovery or controlling scenarios.

51111.51112.description:
Two timers named CommandTime and ReportTime are used for timing out during a node discovery interview. Illustrations are given for secure and non-secure cases in Figure "Node interview ReportTime timeout without security" and Figure "Node interview ReportTime timeout with security" of the Z-Wave Plus Role Type Specification.
  • CommandTime is measured by the application
  • ReportTime timeout SHOULD be set to CommandTime + 1 second

51113.description: Z-Wave is a radio technology with limited bandwidth. Therefore, it is NOT RECOMMENDED to use polling. If used, polling communication MUST comply with the requirements stated in section "Polling Devices" of the Z-Wave Plus Role Type Specification.

51114.description: If the DUT sends Unsolicited Frames it MUST meet the requirements in section “Unsolicited communication” of the Z-Wave Plus Role Type Specification

51115.description: The DUT MUST meet the requirements in section “Runtime communication” of the Z-Wave Plus Role Type Specification

51116.description: The network rediscovery (Request neighbor update) feature SHOULD only be used as last resort in case the runtime communication fails.

51117.description:
Command Class encapsulation MUST be applied in the following order:
  1. Encapsulated Command Class (payload), e.g. Basic Get
  2. Multi Command
  3. Supervision
  4. Multi Channel
  5. Any one of the following combinations:
    1. Security (S0 or S2) followed by transport service
    2. Transport Service
    3. Security (S0 or S2)
    4. CRC16
51117.note:
Note: An exception is made when querying Multi Channel End Points about their secure capabilities. In this case, the S0/S2 Security Commands Supported Report Command is carried in a Multi Channel encapsulation Command, thus, the encapsulation order is:
Security (Multi Channel (Security Commands Supported Get Command))

51117.51118.description:
Responses to a given frame MUST be carried out using the same encapsulation or lack of encapsulation as it was received, unless specified otherwise in the Command Class specification.

The Transport Service Command Class and Multi Command Command Class are exceptions to the above rule.

51117.51119.description: The transport service MUST be used only if the payload does not fit in the Z-Wave MAC frame size.

51117.51120.description: The Multi Command Command Class is optional to use and SHOULD be used only if several commands are queued for transmission.

51121.description: The DUT follows the requirements in the "Node Information Frame" section of the Application Command Class Specification.

51121.51122.description:
The following Command Classes MUST always be in the NIF if supported:
  • Application Status Command Class
  • CRC-16 Encapsulation Command Class
  • Inclusion Controller Command Class
  • Multi Command Command Class
  • Security 2 Command Class
  • Supervision Command Class
  • Time Command Class
  • Transport Service Command Class
  • Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class

51121.51123.description: If present, the list of controlling Command Classes MUST be prepended by the COMMAND_CLASS_MARK Command Class identifier.

51121.51124.description: A node supporting security (S0 and/or S2) MUST advertise command classes in the NIF according to Table "NIF content depending on inclusion and security bootstrapping" in the Application Command Class Specification.

51121.51125.description: Command Classes advertised as supported in the NIF after S0/S2 bootstrapping MUST also be supported at higher security levels unless encapsulated outside security.

51121.51126.description: A node MUST advertise support for Multi Channel Command Class only if it implements End Points. A node able to communicate using the Multi Channel encapsulation but implementing no End Point MUST NOT advertise support for the Multi Channel Command Class.

51121.51127.description: A node able to receive commands encapsulated with the Transport Service, Security. CRC-16 or Multi Command Command Class MUST advertise the respective Command Class as supported and MUST also be able to send commands encapsulated with the respective Command Class.

51128.description: If a node is temporarily not capable to service a Get or Set Command request, it MUST support the Application Status Command Class and send an Application Busy Report Command to the initiator of the Get or Set.

51128.51129.description: The DUT is ALWAYS capable of servicing the GET and SET request.
51128.51129.note: In this case it is OPTIONAL to support the Application Status Command Class.

51131.description: A node MAY send a command to several destinations using a Multicast or Broadcast frame. This is allowed only if the actual command does not require the responding node to return a response.
51131.note: The Z-Wave Multicast frame, the broadcast NodeID and the Multi Channel multi-End Point destination are all considered multicast addressing methods.

51132.description: Unless specified otherwise for a particular command:

51132.51133.description: Commands requiring another command to be returned in response by a receiving node MUST NOT be issued via multicast addressing in a Z-Wave network.

51132.51134.description: A receiving node MUST NOT return a response if a command is received via multicast addressing.

51135.title: Application Command Classes
51135.description:
In this and the following three sections it is identified which version of a Command Class is being implemented and its role (“Support” and/or “Control”).
  • If a Command Class is only controlled via Association Groups, the "Control" role for this Command Class MUST NOT be selected.
  • All Command Classes supported and/or fully or partially controlled by this device MUST be listed in this and the following three sections. This includes the already preselected mandatory CCs according the Device and Role Type of this product as well as any recommended or optional Command Classes that have been implemented. Control (both full control or partial control) means the device implements the ability to send controlling commands (e. g. get or set or level change commands) (except via association groups) or making use of received supporting commands (e. g. reports or notifications).
  • When a Command Class is marked as controlled in the form, the controlling node MUST observe the requirements for the Command Class defined in the Command Class Control Specification.
  • Select only the highest version of the Command Class supported and/or controlled. If the device supports and controls different versions of the same Command Class, please select the highest of both versions and use the comment function on this Command Class form item to leave a note for the test house.
  • The Device Type Specification may list a minimum CC version requirement as mandatory. The developer does have the option of changing the preselected item to a higher version if one is available.
  • For instructions on how to test supported and controlled Command Classes please visit the Application Support wiki page.

51139.51140.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51159.51161.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51167.51168.description: Climate Control Schedule Command Class, version 1 [DEPRECATED]
51167.51168.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51191.51192.description: Door Lock Logging Command Class, version 1

51193.51194.description: Energy Production Command Class, version 1 [NEVER CERTIFIED]
51193.51194.note:
Warning: This command class has never been implemented and certified by a Z-Wave product Therefore, this Command Class definition MAY be updated in a non-backwards compatible manner, or even removed.

Consult with the Z-Wave Alliance Application Work Group if you consider implementing this Command Class.

51205.51206.description: Humidity Control Mode Command Class, version 1

51208.title: Humidity Control Operating State Command Class

51208.51209.description: Humidity Control Operating State Command Class, version 1

51210.51212.description: Humidity Control Setpoint Command Class, version 2

51219.51220.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51255.title: Notification Command Class
51255.note: Note: Do Not mark Alarm CC v1 or v2 if Notification CC is marked.

51277.51278.description: Scene Actuator Configuration Command Class, version 1

51279.51280.description: Scene Controller Configuration Command Class, version 1

51286.51289.description: Schedule Entry Lock Command Class, version 3 [DEPRECATED]
51286.51289.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51308.51313.description: Thermostat Fan Mode Command Class, version 5

51314.51316.description: Thermostat Fan State Command Class, version 2

51321.51323.description: Thermostat Operating State Command Class, version 2

51352.51355.description: Association Group Information Command Class, version 3

51360.51361.description: Device Reset Locally Command Class, version 1

51362.title: Firmware Update Meta Data Command Class

51362.51370.description: Firmware Update Meta Data Command Class, version 8

51383.51386.description: Multi Channel Association Command Class, version 5

51387.title: Node Naming and Location Command Class

51387.51388.description: Node Naming and Location Command Class, version 1

51403.51404.description: Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class, version 2

51406.51407.note: Note: NOT recommended for new devices

51464.description: If a Command Class is supported: The node implements all the Command Class functionalities and can be set and read back by other nodes. When a Command Class is supported, the node is REQUIRED to implement the whole Command Class and observe the requirements specified in the Command Class Specifications.

51470.51471.description: The Root Device and End Points of a Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST advertise the Association Groups indicated in table "Z-Wave Plus v2 minimum required AGI table" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification as a minimum.

51470.51472.description:
A Node or Root Device MUST advertise a “Max Nodes Supported” value of 1 or more for the Lifeline Association group in the Association Report and Multi Channel Association Report Commands.
It is RECOMMENDED to support 5 lifeline destinations.

51470.51473.description: A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST issue all the commands defined in document Association Command Class, list of mandatory commands for the Lifeline Association Group via the Lifeline Association Group to reflect its state changes if the corresponding command is supported by the node.

51470.51474.description: If the state change was triggered by other means than a Z-Wave Command, a node MUST issue the corresponding Report/Notification Command immediately to the lifeline destination(s).

51470.51475.description: If the state change was triggered by a Z-Wave Command:

51470.51475.51476.description: A node MUST NOT issue any Report/Notification Command after a Command received via Multicast/broadcast addressing.

51470.51475.51478.description: Unless the lifeline destination issued the command, a node MUST issue a Report/Notification Command after a command was received using singlecast addressing (including Multi Channel multi-End Point destination) via the Lifeline.

51470.51475.51479.description: If a node has more than one lifeline destination, it MUST issue a Report/Notification Command after a command was received using singlecast addressing (including Multi Channel multi-End Point destination) via the Lifeline.

51470.51480.description: The Z-Wave Plus certification program mandates that association group 1 is reserved for the Lifeline association group. Association group 1 MUST NOT be assigned to any other use than the Lifeline group.

51470.51481.description: The DUT supports the Association CC v3 or higher or the Multi Channel Association CC v4 or higher.

51470.51481.51486.description: The DUT supports the Association CC v4 or the Multi Channel Association CC v5.

51470.51481.51486.51487.description: If a node supports the version 4 of the Association Command Class and the Multi Channel Association Command Class, it MUST support the Multi Channel Association Command, version 5 or newer.

51470.51481.51486.51488.description: If a node supports the version 5 of the Multi Channel Association Command Class and the Association Command Class, it MUST support the Association Command Class, version 4 or newer.

51470.51481.51486.51489.description: Any supporting node MUST learn the granted security classes of a destination before sending controlling or unsolicited supporting commands to a destination via association groups.
51470.51481.51486.51489.note:
Note: It is recommended to follow the discovery sequence listed in section "Association Command Class, version 4 - Interoperability considerations" of the Z-Wave Management Command Class Specification.
CC:0085.04.00.31.001, CC:0085.04.00.32.001

51470.51481.51490.51491.description:
When issuing (supporting or controlling) commands via an association group:
  • A supporting node MUST NOT use Supervision encapsulation if the destination does not support the Supervision Command Class.
  • A supporting node MUST use Supervision encapsulation if the destination supports the Supervision Command Class.

51470.51481.51490.51492.description:
When issuing (supporting or controlling) commands via an association group:
  • A supporting node MUST NOT use Multi Command encapsulation if the destination does not supports the Multi Command Command Class.

51496.title: Firmware Update Meta Data Command Class

51496.51497.description: The configuration of Command Classes that are available before and after a firmware update MUST remain unchanged. For instance, the Lifeline Association Group destination, Wake Up destination and any command class setting MUST stay identical before and after performing a firmware update.

51498.51499.description: In order to increase interoperability with legacy controlling nodes, a node supporting the Security 0 Command Class MUST reply to Manufacturer Specific Get Commands received non-securely if it was granted the S0 network key as its highest Security Class.

51524.title: The DUT implements the following type of Command Class controlling

51524.51525.title: The DUT has one or more Fully or Partially Controlled Command Classes
51524.51525.note:
Note: This field is automatically pre-selected if at least one Command Class has its role set to "Control" in the Command Class sections above.
If this device controls Command Classes ONLY via Association Groups, please do NOT select the "Control" role for any Command Class in the Command Class sections.

51524.51525.51626.51627.title: Association Command Class, version 1-4
51524.51525.51626.51627.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51629.title: Association Group Information (AGI) Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51626.51629.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51631.title: Battery Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51626.51631.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51633.title: Device Reset Locally Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51626.51633.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51635.title: Firmware Update Meta Data Command Class, version 1-6
51524.51525.51626.51635.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51637.title: Indicator Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51626.51637.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51639.title: Multi Channel Association Command Class, version 2-5
51524.51525.51626.51639.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51641.title: Version Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51626.51641.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51626.51643.title: Wake-Up Command Class, version 1-2
51524.51525.51626.51643.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51526.51527.description: If a Command Class is controlled: The node implements the ability to interview, read and/or set other nodes supporting the Command Class. Nodes controlling Command Classes MAY use a subset of the Commands within a Command Class (for example only Set commands).

51524.51525.51526.51528.description: When a Command Class is marked as fully controlled during certification, the controlling node is said to implement "full" control of the actual Command Class and it MUST observe the requirements for the Command Class defined in the Command Class Control Specification .

51524.51525.51526.51529.description: The Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification mandates some nodes to control a given set of Command Classes. It means that the controlling node MUST respect the requirements described in this document for the actual Command Classes.

51524.51525.51526.51530.description: A controlling node MUST read the capabilities and secure capabilities of a node/End Point once before trying to control a given Command Class.

51524.51525.51526.51531.description:
A controlling node MUST read the Command Class version number of a supporting node using the Version Command Class prior to controlling the Command Class. There can be two exceptions to this rule:
  • If the controlling node controls only version 1 of a given Command Class, it may skip requesting the supporting node version for the actual Command Class.
  • A controlling node may issue version 1 commands in the supporting node interview before knowing the supporting node Command Class’ version. (e.g., when interviewing the Version Command Class itself)

51524.51525.51526.51532.description: A node controlling a given command class MUST allow an end user to control the command class in all listening supporting nodes present in the network operating with a security class that is granted to the controlling node.

51524.51525.51526.51533.description: A node controlling a Command Class MUST allow an end user to control a sleeping supporting node if it is the Wake Up destination.

51524.51525.51526.51534.description: This interview MUST be performed prior to issuing any control command to the supporting node.
51524.51525.51526.51534.note:
Preferably, it should be done during the commissioning phase of the supporting node or shortly after the inclusion of the controlling node.

CL:0000.00.21.02.1

51524.51525.51526.51535.description: A “fully” controlling node MUST NOT skip or abort the interview of a Command Class if another independent Command Class could not be correctly interviewed.

51524.51525.51526.51536.description: A “partially” controlling node MAY skip steps in the specified frame flow if the queried data would not be used by the controller, or the data is retrieved from a separate source (i.e. database of Manufacturer Specific information and capabilities).

51524.51525.51526.51537.description: Partial Control MAY be used for Application Command Classes only. Management and Transport-Encapsulation Command Class MUST be fully controlled.

51524.51525.51526.51538.description:
The following order for reading Command Class capabilities is RECOMMENDED after discovering the Security Class and encapsulation capabilities of a node:
  • Version Command Class
  • Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class
  • Wake Up Command Class
  • Association OR Multi Channel Association Command Class
  • Association Group Information (AGI) Command Class
  • Actuator Command Classes
  • Data reporting Command Classes
  • Multi Channel Command Class (and repeat the above order for each End Point, if any)

51524.51525.51526.51539.description: Some interviews or controlling scenarios may trigger no response in return to get type commands. In this case, it is RECOMMENDED to use timeouts according to the Z-Wave Plus Role Type Specification.

51524.51525.51526.51540.description: The minimum end user functionalities section in the Command Class Control Specification specifies what minimum set of actions an end user can perform on a supporting node when using the controlling node.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51541.description: Each section describing a required functionality indicates the command(s) that MUST be transmitted on the Z-Wave radio for full control.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51542.description: Fields not present or described in the mandatory command(s) MAY be used freely by the controlling node either automatically or based on user input.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51543.description: Fields indicated as "user defined" MUST be filled based on end user input. In this case, the end user MUST be able to select any value. (e.g. if the field is 2 bytes long, values from 0 to 65535 MUST be available)

51524.51525.51526.51540.51544.description: Fields indicated as "User defined among supported" MUST be filled based on user input and the supported values by the supporting node. The controlling node MUST allow the end user to set values supported by a supporting node even if it does not know what a given value represents.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51545.description: Fields indicated as "User defined among x..y and z" MUST be filled based on user input and MUST be able to select between the indicated values.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51546.description: Fields indicated as “User defined or x” MUST be filled either based on user input or automatically by the controller using the indicated value.

51524.51525.51526.51540.51547.description: The product documentation MUST point out how to perform each action associated to the minimum end user functionalities required by a Command Class.

51524.51525.51526.51548.description: Like a supporting node implements a version of its supported Command Classes, a controlling node MUST also implement a given version of a Command Class it controls. A node controlling version 3 of a Command Class will be able to control the functionalities of version 1, 2 and 3 supporting nodes.

51524.51525.51526.51549.description:
When issuing commands, a controlling node MUST NOT use the fields described in the mandatory commands sections if they belong to a newer version than the version it claims to control.

If a controlling node A controls a node B supporting a lower version, node A SHOULD still use the format (command payload) corresponding to the version node A controls, regardless of the version supported by node B.

A controlling node A sending commands to a node B supporting a lower version MUST NOT use commands introduced in versions that are newer than Node B’s version.

A node controlling a Command Class is not mandated to interview, provide minimum end user functionality or show node properties belonging to a newer version of the actual Command Class.

51524.51525.51526.51550.description: When a version is indicated in the mandatory interview or mandatory commands for end user functionalities, it MUST represent the minimum common version number between the supporting and controlling node. For example, with a version 4 controlling node and version 2 supporting node, the interview, minimum end user functionalities and properties MUST follow version 1 and 2 indications.

51524.51525.51526.51551.header: Command Classes not present in the Command Class Control Specification
51524.51525.51526.51551.description: A node MAY advertise that it controls a Command Class not (yet) defined in the Command Class Control Specification during certification.

51524.51525.51526.51551.51552.description: The DUT controls Command Classes that are not defined in the Command Class Control Specification
51524.51525.51526.51551.51552.note: Use the below text field to list all Command Classes that are controlled by the DUT but are NOT defined in the Command Class Control Specification.
51524.51525.51526.51551.51552.custom:
Alarm Sensor
Binary Sensor
Climate Control Schedule
Clock
Color Switch
Door Lock Logging
Energy Production
Humidity Control Mode
Humidity Control Operating State
Humidity Control Setpoint
Irrigation
Language
Lock
Manufacturer Specific
No Operation
Node Naming and Location
Powerlevel
Protection
Scene Activation
Scene Actuator Configuration
Scene Controller Configuration
Schedule Entry Lock
Thermostat Fan Mode
Thermostat Fan State
Thermostat Operating State
Time
Time Parameters
Transport Service
Z-Wave Plus Info

zatsValues.value:
Alarm Sensor
Binary Sensor
Climate Control Schedule
Clock
Color Switch
Door Lock Logging
Energy Production
Humidity Control Mode
Humidity Control Operating State
Humidity Control Setpoint
Irrigation
Language
Lock
Manufacturer Specific
No Operation
Node Naming and Location
Powerlevel
Protection
Scene Activation
Scene Actuator Configuration
Scene Controller Configuration
Schedule Entry Lock
Thermostat Fan Mode
Thermostat Fan State
Thermostat Operating State
Time
Time Parameters
Transport Service
Z-Wave Plus Info

51524.51525.51526.51551.51552.51553.description:
In this case, the controlling node MUST comply with the following guidelines:
  • It MUST use all Get type commands to read the nodes capabilities during the node interview.
  • It SHOULD provide the end user actions using all Set type Commands available in the Command Class.
  • It SHOULD show or let the end user access all relevant state/property/configuration relating to the Command Class using the Report type Commands available in the Command Class.
A controller following this guideline is likely to be compliant when a new control specification is released for an actual Command Class.

51524.51525.51526.51555.header: Filtering Security Class for controlling nodes
51524.51525.51526.51555.description: For Command Classes supported securely, a controlling node MUST discard the command from a supporting node if not received at the highest common security level between the controlling node and the sending S2 node.

51524.51525.51526.51556.description: A controlling node MUST NOT discard a command if the sending node does not support the S2 Command Class.

51524.51525.51526.51557.description: Further, a controller node that has performed S2 bootstrapping to a Node A SHOULD discard controlling commands from Node A if not received using the highest common security level for Command Classes that are always supported non-securely (always in the NIF).

51524.51525.51526.51558.description: Any Z-Wave Plus v2 node controlling Command Classes (not using association groups) MUST discover the destination capabilities using every Security Class. If it intends to create associations between 2 other nodes, it MUST also discover which keys have been granted to both nodes.
51524.51525.51526.51558.note:
Note: If the controlling node is the SIS, it SHOULD skip the discovery as it knows which keys have been granted. If the controlling node is not the SIS or does not know which security levels to use with a destination, it follows the discovery sequence recommended in section "Controlling nodes: Security Class learning" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification.

DT:00.21.001D.2, DT:00.22.0005.1

51524.51525.51559.51563.title: Barrier Operator Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51559.51563.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51566.title: Basic Command Class, version 1-2
51524.51525.51559.51566.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51569.title: Binary Switch Command Class, version 1-2
51524.51525.51559.51569.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51572.title: Central Scene Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51559.51572.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51575.title: Color Switch Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51559.51575.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51578.title: Configuration Command Class, version 1-4
51524.51525.51559.51578.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51581.title: Door Lock Command Class, version 1-4
51524.51525.51559.51581.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51584.title: Entry Control Command Class, version 1

51524.51525.51559.51590.title: Meter Command Class, version 1-5
51524.51525.51559.51590.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51593.title: Multilevel Sensor Command Class, version 1-11
51524.51525.51559.51593.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51596.title: Multilevel Switch Command Class, version 1-4

51524.51525.51559.51599.title: Notification Command Class, version 1-8

51524.51525.51559.51605.title: Sound Switch Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51559.51605.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51608.title: Thermostat Mode Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51559.51608.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51611.title: Thermostat Setback Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51559.51611.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51614.title: Thermostat Setpoint Command Class, version 1-3
51524.51525.51559.51614.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51617.title: User Code Command Class, version 1-2
51524.51525.51559.51617.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51559.51623.title: Window Covering Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51559.51623.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51645.51646.title: CRC-16 Encapsulation Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51645.51646.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51645.51648.title: Multi Channel Command Class, version 3-4
51524.51525.51645.51648.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51645.51650.title: Security 0 Command Class
51524.51525.51645.51650.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51645.51652.title: Security 2 Command Class
51524.51525.51645.51652.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51524.51525.51645.51654.title: Supervision Command Class, version 1
51524.51525.51645.51654.description: The DUT complies with the specific control requirements for this Command Class as defined in the Command Class Control Specification.

51665.51668.title: The product is based on a Controller Role Type

51665.51668.51670.description: The controller can include as secure devices, compliant controller and end devices of any type from any manufacturer as long as they support the Security Command Class.
51665.51668.51670.note: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item.

51665.51668.51671.description: Controllers MUST be able to perform Security 0 bootstrapping if they support the Security 0 Command Class.

51665.51668.51674.description: If the SIS and the Inclusion Controller both support the Inclusion Controller Command Class, the SIS MUST NOT perform S0 bootstrapping. The SIS should instruct the Inclusion Controller to perform S0 bootstrapping or interview the included node non-securely.

51680.title: Security 2 (S2) Command Class
51680.note: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the attached Wiki page.

51680.51684.description: A node supporting S2 MUST consider any Security Class lower than its highest granted Security Class as unsecure communication.

51680.51684.51685.description: Certain command classes, such as Transport Service or Z-Wave Plus Info, must always be supported non-securely and present in the NIF if they are supported by a node. In this case, non-secure support requirements are specified in each individual command class definition. A list of these special Command Classes is also available in document List of defined Z-Wave Command Classes, under “Additional Comments”.

51680.51686.description: By default, a node supporting S2 MUST support its Command Classes only at the highest granted Security Class. If no Security Class was granted, the node MUST support all its Command Class using non-secure communication.

51680.51717.description: The including node or the joining node MUST apply timeouts according to Table "Security 2 bootstrapping Timeouts" in the Z-Wave Transport Encapsulation Command Class Specification.
51680.51717.note:
CC:009F.01.00.11.07D

Note: "Negative Testing" is part of the "S2C" tests in section "S2 Certification" if available.

51680.51718.header: ECDH key pairs, Device Specific Key and User Verification
51680.51718.description:
A node supporting S2 MUST have a first Learn Mode ECDH key pair:
  • This key pair is used for joining a network both with and without authentication during S2 Bootstrapping. However, if the node also has a second Learn Mode ECDH key pair, then the first key pair is only used when the S2 Bootstrapping requires authentication.
  • This key pair MUST be static.

A node supporting S2 MAY have a second Learn Mode ECDH key pair:
  • This key pair is used for joining a network when the S2 Bootstrapping does not require authentication.
  • This key pair MAY be dynamic.

Additionally, a node able to perform S2 bootstrapping MUST have an additional separate Add Mode ECDH key pair:
  • This key pair is used for adding nodes into a network (controller side).
  • This key pair MUST be dynamic.

51734.title: Security 2 (S2) Command Class - Controllers
51734.description: The following items describe additional requirements for controllers supporting Security 2 Command Class
51734.note: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the attached Wiki page.

51734.51739.title: Requirements related to Controller network roles

51734.51739.51740.header: The DUT supports the SIS network role
51734.51739.51740.description: If a controller has the SIS role:

51734.51739.51740.51741.description: It MUST support the SIS side of the Inclusion Controller Command Class

51734.51739.51740.51743.description: It MUST support inclusion of nodes that implement any combination of Security 2 Security Classes

51734.51739.51740.51744.description: It MUST have input and display method for support of all Security Classes

51734.51739.51740.51745.description: It MAY support inclusion using CSA

51734.51739.51740.51745.51747.description: The DUT does NOT support inclusion using CSA.

51734.51755.51756.description: A controller with a user interface for PIN code input (and optionally a QR scanning capability) MUST comply with following when bootstrapping S2 nodes:

51734.51755.51756.51757.description: It MUST grant membership of all requested Classes if the joining node requests membership of the S2 Access Control Class (unless specified otherwise by a user).

51734.51755.51756.51758.description: It MAY ask the user for confirmation before granting S2 Authenticated Class key if the node does not request membership of the S2 Access Control Class.

51734.51755.51756.51759.description: It SHOULD provide a way to inspect and adjust the list of the Security Class memberships that will be granted to the joining node.

51734.51755.51756.51759.51760.description: The DUT follows the above recommendation.

51734.51765.description: If a node has been security bootstrapped with the S0 Command Class in a S2 capable network, the SIS/Primary controller MUST issue a warning message to the user informing that the node has not been included securely.

51734.51765.51766.description: The SIS/Primary controller SHOULD request a new NIF to the included node after security bootstrapping to verify if the included node supports S2 before issuing the message to the user.

51734.51767.description: If an S2 node has not been granted the highest requested S2 key during bootstrapping, the SIS/Primary controller MUST issue a warning message to the user informing that the node has not been included with the highest security. This is OPTIONAL if the user has actively chosen which keys to grant and security bootstrapping completed successfully.

51794.title: DUT can perform SmartStart Inclusion of other nodes

51794.51795.description: A controller providing control of the SmartStart functionality is NOT REQUIRED to support the SmartStart functionality and support being included in a network using SmartStart inclusion.

51794.51796.header: Control Requirements from Role Type Specification
51794.51796.description: A controller shall have the Primary Controller role in the network to perform a SmartStart inclusion. Secondary Controllers (and Inclusion Controllers) shall not perform SmartStart inclusions.

51794.51797.description: A controller performing a SmartStart network inclusion shall perform S2 bootstrapping (even if the joining node does not show the S2 Command Class in its supported Command Class list).

51794.51798.description:
A Z/IP Gateway providing the SmartStart functionality MUST support the following Command Classes on the IP side:
  • Network Management Inclusion Command Class, version 3 or newer

A Z/IP Gateway providing the SmartStart functionality SHOULD support the following Command Classes on the IP side:
  • Node Provisioning Command Class

51794.51799.description:
When a SmartStart including controller has received the DSK of a node for inclusion, it shall keep NWI Mode enabled for at least 'nwkMinNWIModeSmartStartDuration' minutes if the node does not get included.

nwkMinNWIModeSmartStartDuration = 60 (minutes): Minimum duration in which NWI mode shall stay enabled after a controller node has received a SmartStart DSK to include.

51794.51800.description: Controller tries again to include a node that has auto-reset after a failed SmartStart inclusion.

51794.51801.description: A controller providing control of the SmartStart functionality MUST:

51794.51801.51802.description: Provide a method for the end user to view the Node Provisioning List entries with their network inclusion status (included/ not included or failed).

51794.51801.51803.description: Provide a method for the end user to manually add and remove entries in the Node Provisioning List.

51794.51801.51804.description: Provide a method for the end user to edit available settings for each entry in the Node Provisioning List (e.g., Inclusion setting, Advanced joining). A controller application MAY provide no available settings.

51794.51801.51805.description: Support S2 inclusion with authentication using the DSK PIN code.

51794.51806.description: If a user removes a node from the Node Provisioning List and the node is still included in the Z-Wave network, the controller MUST inform the end user that the node will stay in the network and requires to be excluded manually or reset to factory default in order to leave the Z-Wave Network.

51794.51807.description: A controller MUST inform the end user that S2 only (non-SmartStart) nodes present in the Provisioning List require to perform a classic inclusion to add them into the Z-Wave network.

51794.51808.description: A controller providing the SmartStart functionality SHOULD provide a QR Code scanning capability.

51794.51808.51809.description: The DUT follows the above recommendation.

51794.51808.51809.51810.description: It MUST support the addition of nodes using QR Code format defined in the Node Provisioning QR Code Format Specification in its Provisioning List when scanning the QR Code.

51794.51808.51809.51811.description: It SHOULD support scanning of Gen1 QR Codes, refer to Node Provisioning QR Code Format.

51794.51808.51809.51811.51812.description: The DUT follows the above recommendation.

51816.51822.description: This product is NOT based on any of the listed Certified Software Design Versions.
51816.51822.note: Note: Additional tests and fees are required for "S2 Certification" (S2C) if a controller DUT is not based on any of the listed Certified Software Design Versions that can be selected within the "Certification Data" section. Contact the ZWA Cert Admin if a Certified Software Design Version shall be added.

51825.title: Controller User Interface
51825.note: Identify the primary user interface for this device

51825.51830.description: This controller utilizes a web based graphical user interface

51834.51835.description: Network Management functionality is included in the application/GUI

51842.51843.description: It is not acceptable to block interoperability by any means.

51842.51844.description: It is not acceptable to prevent inclusion of certified devices into a system or force exclusion of non-preferred devices after inclusion.

51842.51845.description: Devices from non-preferred manufacturers MAY be placed in a special section of the user interface; this section should be referred to as "Additional Z-Wave Ecosystem Devices".

51849.title: Minimal Control Functionality
51849.description:
If a controller product supports short range wireless non-Z-Wave technology smarthome products (e.g. light bulbs, thermostats, door locks and the like) and Z-Wave technology products, it MUST, at a minimum, control the following Command Classes:
  • Door Lock Command Class
  • Binary Switch Command Class
  • Multilevel Switch Command Class
  • Thermostat Mode Command Class
  • Thermostat Setpoint Command Class

51850.51851.description: A controller MUST have a menu or method for an (advanced) end user to request the controller to perform a capability discovery for a given node (i.e. to perform a complete commissioning interview)

51850.51852.description: After any device issued a Configuration Report advertising a dynamic capabilities parameter value change, a controlling node MUST NOT perform the node interview unless instructed to do so by the end user.

51850.51853.description: If such a controlling node does not implement any End Points, it MUST NOT advertise the Multi Channel Command Class in its Node Information Frame (NIF) or S0/S2 Commands Supported Report Command.

51850.51856.description: It is RECOMMENDED that a controller does not display a newly included node as ready to be operated during the commissioning phase.

51857.title: S2 Certification
51857.description: The Form Items in this section and their assosiated tests apply if a Z-Wave Controller is neither based on Z/IP Gateway nor Unify Controller. Additional certification fees apply.

51858.51865.description: KEX Set / KEX Set Echo Command - Failing S2 Bootstrapping

51858.51867.description: Public Key Report Command - Failed Authentication

51858.51872.description: S2 Nonce Get and Report Commands

51858.51880.description: Message Encapsulation Command - Sequence Number, Reserved field and Extension flag

51858.51882.description: Message Encapsulation Command - Valid Encrypted Extensions

51858.51885.description: Message Encapsulation Command - MPAN Extension - More to Follow field

51858.51886.description: Message Encapsulation Command - MPAN Extension Group ID field

51858.51891.note: Note: "Positive Testing" is part of the "S2" tests in section "Security Requirements".

51892.51893.51895.description: KEX Report / KEX Report Echo (V1) Command - Failing Inclusion

51906.description: DUT can include nodes into a Z-Wave Long Range network

51906.51907.description: Z-Wave Long Range Controller MUST be able to include a node supporting Z-Wave Long Range into the Controller Long Range network.

51906.51908.description: Controller nodes that can include other nodes using Z-Wave Long Range MUST allow to configure the Bootstrapping Mode TLV of provisioning list entries to "Z-Wave Long Range SmartStart" (value 0x02) for entries that advertise Z-Wave Long Range as a supported protocol.

51906.51909.description: A controller node MUST only grant Security Classes that require Authentication for the S2 Bootstrapping during a Z-Wave Long Range SmartStart inclusion

51906.51910.description: Controllers using S2 shall use different keys for identical S2 Security Classes in the Z-Wave and the Z-Wave Long Range network, i.e. the S2 Authenticated key in the Z-Wave network cannot decrypt S2 Authenticated messages from the Z-Wave Long Range network.

51911.title: Required Documentation
51911.description: The following requirements for end user documentation apply to all Z-Wave Plus v2 compliant products. The documentation may be provided as product manuals, quick start guides, electronic help files, web pages, etc.

51912.title: Terminology
51912.description: The product documentation MUST use the terminology indicated in Table "Z-Wave Plus v2 documentation terminology" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification for Z-Wave related functionality.

51913.title: Documentation for Classic Inclusion and Exclusion

51913.51917.description: For Z-Wave Controller Role Types, the documentation MUST describe:

51913.51917.51919.description: How to include and exclude other devices.
51913.51917.51919.note: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51913.51917.51921.description: The documentation MUST describe how an (advanced) end user can perform a capability rediscovery of a chosen node.
51913.51917.51921.note:
DT:00.31.0013.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51922.51928.description: For controllers providing the SmartStart functionality, the documentation MUST describe:

51922.51928.51929.description: How to perform a secure inclusion of a SmartStart node (adding the node in the Node Provisioning List and powering up/installing the node)

51922.51928.51930.description: How to access and edit the Node Provisioning List.

51931.title: Documentation for Z-Wave Long Range
51931.description:
Nodes supporting Z-Wave Long Range MUST indicate in their documentation if they can be included and/or if they can include other nodes using Z-Wave Long Range.

Controller nodes that can include other nodes using Z-Wave Long Range MUST indicate how to change the bootstrapping mode (Z-Wave SmartStart vs. Z-Wave Long Range SmartStart) of provisioning list entries.

51935.title: Documentation for Partial Control
51935.description: If a Command Class is partially controlled and some minimum end user functionality are not met, the product documentation MUST describe how the partially controlled command class differs from the behavior of a fully controlled command class.
51935.note:
CL:0000.00.31.07.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51937.title: Documentation for Association Command Class
51937.description: The documentation MUST include a description of the association groups available in the product.
51937.note:
DT:00.31.0009.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51937.51938.description:
Each group MUST include the following information:
  • Grouping identifier
  • Maximum number of devices that can be added to the group
  • Description of how the association group is used and/or triggered by the product
  • Description of any mapping between groups (e.g. Root Device mirrored End Point group)

51943.title: Documentation for Factory Default Reset
51943.description: The product documentation MUST include instructions on how to perform a reset to factory default operation.
51943.note:
RT:00.11.000B.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51944.title: Documentation for Identity Function
51944.description: The product documentation MUST describe how product can be identified using the Indicator Command Class with the Indicator ID 0x50 (identify).
51944.note:
DT:00.31.0016.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51947.title: Documentation for Security 2 Command Class
51947.description: The documentation MUST list the supported Command Classes, their version and their required Security class if any.
51947.note:
DT:00.31.000F.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

51948.title: Documentation for Supervision Command Class
51948.description: If a node supports the Supervision Command Class, the product documentation MUST describe the list of cases and/or conditions where it would issue a Supervision Report Command with a status indicating WORKING or FAIL, for a valid and supported set of parameters in the encapsulated command.
51948.note:
For example, it is not necessary to describe that a Supervision encapsulated Association Set Command would return FAIL if trying to establish a new association in a group that is already full.

DT:00.31.0015.1

51952.description: In addition to the rules defined above the following technical documentation MUST be made available to the certification test lab upon submitting the product for certification:
51952.note:
Note: All documentation is provided in English language; or other arrangements have been made with the test lab.

DT:00.31.0002.1

51952.51953.description: Documentation about how to activate any functionality available in the device related to Z-Wave behavior.

51952.51954.description: If any special procedures are REQUIRED to test any item in the certification form, such procedures MUST be clearly described.

51952.51955.description: If the product is a Z-Wave controller, documentation on how to send any controlled command from the controller MUST be included.
51952.51955.note: Note: This item is mandatory if the DUT is a Controller.

51956.title: Association Group Data
51956.description: In this section the implemented Association Groups of the DUT are defined. Please enter the same data as in the Association and Association Group Info Reports from the DUT.

51957.title: Association Group Data
51957.note: Association Group 1 must be defined as 'Lifeline' group both in your submission and in your product documentation.

51957.51958-001.51960.note: The maximum number of destinations supported by the advertised association group.

51957.51958-001.51963.note: This field is used to indicate the assigned name for the actual Group Identifier.

51957.51958-001.51964.note: This field is used to advertise the profile of the actual association group. Refer to section "Profile" and Table "AGI Profiles" in document Z-Wave Management Command Class Specification.

51957.51958-001.51965.description: Command Class and Command (multiple byte pairs)
51957.51958-001.51965.note: This field contains the identifiers of the Command Classes and Commands which are sent to the Node IDs of the Association Group. Enter the full byte sequence for all group Commands as returned by the DUT. (e.g. 0x20015A01 for a Basic Set and a Device Reset Locally Notification Command). Command Class and Command identifiers can be found in file ZW_classcmd.h file from the SDKs.

52658.52659.title: This is a Z-Wave device that contains application software

52658.52659.52660.52661.header: Provide the values returned in the Version CC V2 Report in this section. All values are 8 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A
52658.52659.52660.52661.note:
The Hardware Version field MUST report a value which is unique to this particular version of the product.
  • It MUST be possible to uniquely determine the hardware characteristics from the Hardware Version field in combination with the Manufacturer ID, Product Type ID and Product ID fields of Manufacturer Specific Info Report of the Manufacturer Specific Command Class.
  • The Hardware Version field is intended for the hardware version of the entire product, not just the version of the Z-Wave radio chip.
  • For software application products the version of the used hardware platform should be returned in this field or 0 if the version can not be determined.

52658.52659.52660.52662.note: Firmware 0 is dedicated to the Z-Wave chip firmware.  The manufacturer MUST assign a version and sub version number

52658.52659.52660.52664.note:
The Number of Firmware Targets field MUST report the number of firmware Version plus Sub Version fields following this field (Firmware 1….n).
  • The Firmware 0 Version fields are not included.
  • The field MUST be zero if the device only implements a Firmware 0 target for the Z-Wave chip.

52658.52659.52660.52665.header: The following fields are required for all additional firmware targets.

52658.52659.52671.52672.header: Provide the values returned in the Manufacturer Specific report in this section. All values are 16 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A01
52658.52659.52671.52672.note: Note: The Manufacturer ID is assigned by the Z-Wave Alliance and must reference the company that owns the product brand. To obtain an ID please forward a request to the ZWA Cert Admin (certadmin@z-wavealliance.org).

52658.52659.52671.52673.header: The Product Type ID and Prod ID numbers are assigned by the manufacturer and are intended for use in identifying and differentiating various products from the same manufacturer.  These numbers MUST be unique for each device being certified. All values are
52658.52659.52671.52673.note: The Product Type ID field SHOULD carry a unique ID identifying the actual product type. A specific Product Type ID MUST be defined by the manufacturer for each type of product.

52658.52659.52671.52674.note: The Product ID field SHOULD carry a unique ID identifying the actual product. A specific Product ID MUST be defined by the manufacturer for each product of a given product type. The same Product ID value may appear for different Product Type ID values.

52658.52659.52675.52676.header: Provide the values returned in the Z-Wave Plus Info report in this section. All values are 16 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A01
52658.52659.52675.52676.note: The Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class is used to differentiate between Z-Wave Plus v2, Z-Wave Plus, Z-Wave for IP and Z-Wave devices.  The Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class also defines two icon types that allow for a meaningful representation in user and installer Graphical User Interfaces (GUI).  A Z-Wave Plus v2 product MUST specify valid icon types; however the manufacturer can freely choose suitable icon types for their product among those available on the Z-Wave Alliance website.
